author: Business Insider
title: Support is coming in for an embattled Biden — from Trumpworld – DNyuz
text:
July 12, 2024 in News , Politics 493 SHARES 1.4k VIEWS Share on Facebook Share on Twitter President Joe Biden is still under pressure to drop out of the race after his uneven performance at Thursday’s press conference. But he’s getting some support — and it’s coming from Trumpworld.
Former President Donald Trump is slated to face off against Biden this November, and it looks like his family and campaign team are rooting for Biden to remain his opponent.
“I think he’s doing OK enough to stay. The press, I think their mission was to try to get him out with this, but I don’t think they are going to,” Donald Trump Jr. said in a livestream on Thursday.
Trump’s eldest son weighed in on Biden’s candidacy in the latest episode of his podcast, “Triggered with Don Jr.” Notably, Trump Jr. sprinkled in some praise for Biden while volleying insults at him.
“I don’t think anyone wants to call this guy at an emergency at 3 o’clock in the morning but you know, he did an hour. It’s almost an hour,” Trump Jr. said midway through Biden’s press conference.
“I think he did better than I actually thought he was going to do. I don’t think it was a great job by any means, but I think it’s a big one,” he said near the end of the podcast.
Will Biden be able to limp through tonight’s presser?They scheduled it past his bedtime.My live reaction along with Kari Lake @KariLake – see you at 6 pm et on Rumble!!! https://t.co/SCVTUQbMSc pic.twitter.com/DxZoiZys83
— Donald Trump Jr. (@DonaldJTrumpJr) July 11, 2024
The Trump camp is itching for a 2020 rematch The New York Times’ Jonathan Swan reported on Thursday that people close to Trump are rejoicing that Biden performed decently at the press conference.
Swan wrote that Trump’s people believe it’ll now be harder for the Democratic Party to boot Biden off the ticket — and they’re holding on to hope that Trump can secure a landslide victory if Biden stays his opponent.
Also on Thursday, Politico spoke to a Trump advisor who was granted anonymity to discuss the campaign.
“Democrats’ worst nightmare is unfolding,” the advisor told the outlet. “He gave us enough new material and may stave off his insurrection.”
The Trump campaign had already expressed its preference for Biden as a candidate even before Biden’s disastrous debate on June 27.
Trump’s campaign advisor Susie Wiles also called Biden a “gift” in an interview with The Atlantic’s Tim Alberta in mid-June, which was published Wednesday.
When approached for comment, a spokesperson for Trump pointed to a clip of Trump speaking at a campaign event in Florida on Tuesday.
“Despite all the Democrat panic this week, the truth is, it doesn’t matter who they nominate because we are going to beat anyone of them in a thundering landslide,” Trump said.
PRESIDENT TRUMP: Despite all the Democrat panic this week, the truth is, it doesn’t matter who they nominate—because we are going to beat ANY ONE of them in a thundering landslide this November—because we have the policies that will Make America Great Again, and they don’t. pic.twitter.com/5JBtLa5FnZ
— Trump War Room (@TrumpWarRoom) July 10, 2024
Biden has repeatedly insisted that he’ll not step away from his 2024 bid, but his party might not share that same zeal.
At least 16 House Democrats and one Democratic senator have called on Biden to quit following his poor debate performance .
Others, like former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, haven’t explicitly called for Biden’s removal but held back from endorsing him as the party’s candidate.
“It’s up to the president to decide if he is going to run. We’re all encouraging him to make that decision. Because time is running short,” Pelosi said during an interview with MSNBC’s “Morning Joe” on Wednesday.
Representatives for Biden didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment from BI sent outside regular business hours.
The post Support is coming in for an embattled Biden — from Trumpworld appeared first on Business Insider .

author: 三立新聞網
title: 新北市客家人口最多在這裡！板橋客家鄉親站出來 力挺罷免葉元之
text:
記者劉秀敏／台北報導
▲民進黨客家事務部舉辦「義民護台灣，客家大團結」罷免行動。（圖／民進黨提供）
大罷免首波24藍委投開票將於7月26日登場，民進黨客家事務部23日上午在新北市板橋舉辦「義民護台灣，客家大團結」罷免行動，邀請諸多在地客家鄉親參與，展現客家族群在關鍵時刻挺身守護民主的力量，台灣客家聯盟協會創會理事長楊長鎮、民進黨副秘書長何博文、新北市議員山田摩衣、黃淑君也到場聲援板橋大刪元團隊，呼籲大家7月26日踴躍投下「同意罷免」的一票，終結親中賣台、罔顧民意的立委。
民進黨客家部表示，面對中共滲透，蠶食台灣主權，客家鄉親勇敢挺身，展現「當哪裡有需要，我們就在哪裡」的客家忠義精神，投入罷免全台不適任立委的行動。客家文學大師李喬曾說：「台灣正有難，反抗就是愛。」當家園遭遇危機，客家人一向奮不顧身、挺身而出，保鄉衛土，這正是客家義民精神。
民進黨客家部指出，根據統計，板橋區為新北市客家人口最多的行政區，擁有超過11萬名客家鄉親，佔總人口近20%。面對中共勢力滲透，藍白成為在地協力者，各種降低中共侵卻台灣成本的作為，現場客家鄉親表示要發揮現代義民精神，號召更多板橋的市民朋友7月26日一同投下「同意罷免」來守護台灣、捍衛得來不易的民主。
何博文表示，葉元之在立法院未反映民意，反而緊跟傅崐萁推動違憲擴權法案，甚至在預算審查期間支持刪除「165防詐騙專線」等關鍵預算，「面對詐騙橫行，編列強化防詐騙相關預算，國民黨竟選擇刪除，這根本就是不在乎人民被詐騙。」此外，國民黨大撒幣普發一萬元，卻用2300億擴編預算、需大幅舉債來支應，沒有財源配套也違憲違法，根本是「債留子孫、慷全民之慨」。
何博文進一步提到，藍白立委還提出人民在立法院的要求之下，全民包含任何公司行號、企業都要到立法院說明，提供個人身家資料、公司財務報表，且不能拒絕。幸好被大法官宣告違憲，但藍白立委不肯罷休，進而癱瘓憲法法庭，侵害人民救濟程序。
罷免葉元之團體「板橋大刪元」志工汪汪表示，藍白立委毀憲亂政很明顯就是要讓中共更容易拿下台灣，如果這次大罷免沒有過關，很有可能是我們最後一次行使公民參政權，所以大罷免一定要大成功。
台灣客家聯盟協會創會理事長楊長鎮則說，葉元之在立法院審查機密預算時直播，這已經涉及洩密。大罷免能讓全台灣的客家鄉親決定，汰換親共賣台的立法委員，讓國會重新改造，還給人民。

author: Elaph Publishing Limited
title: وهم التحول المفاجئ للطاقة المتجددة!
text:
علي محمد الحازمي
منتدى باريس للمناخ وغيرها من المنظمات الدولية التي تنادي بسرعة التحول للطاقة المتجددة تُشعرك لوهلة أنها تعيش خارج كوكب الأرض ولا ترى ما يحدث على أرض الواقع. كيف لنا أن نقنع تلك المنظمات أن الطلب على الطاقة التقليدية يزداد بشكل مطرد، وحتى تتضح الرؤية، مثّلت مراكز البيانات حوالى 1.8% من استهلاك الكهرباء العالمي في عام 2024، بزيادة 13% سنويًا على مدى السنوات الخمس الماضية. قادت تلك الارتفاعات كلا من الولايات المتحدة وأوروبا والصين بواقع 85% من استهلاك مراكز البيانات.
يتطلب الذكاء الاصطناعي قوة حوسبة هائلة لمعالجة المعلومات المتراكمة في قواعد بيانات ضخمة. هذه الحقيقة تؤكد أنه لا يمكن أن ينخفض الطلب في خضمّ السباق نحو الهيمنة على الذكاء الاصطناعي، التي تُغذّي شركات التكنولوجيا توسّعًا غير مسبوق في مراكز البيانات. تُشغّل هذه البنى التحتية الرقمية كل شيء، من محرّكات البحث إلى الحوسبة السحابية، وتطبيقات الذكاء الاصطناعي بشكلٍ متزايد. ومن انعكاسات، هذا الارتفاع الهائل في طلب الذكاء الاصطناعي على الطاقة الحاسوبية، تتزايد أيضًا بصمته في استهلاك الطاقة التقليدية.
المؤكد أن عصر تسارع الذكاء الاصطناعي اليوم يتميّز بارتفاع هائل في الطلب على الطاقة بكافة أشكالها، حيث تتطلب التطبيقات خاصة تلك التي تعتمد على الذكاء الاصطناعي أجهزة متخصصة كثيفة الاستهلاك للطاقة. كما أن الانتشار السريع لتقنيات الذكاء الاصطناعي يدفع استهلاك الطاقة في مراكز البيانات إلى مستويات غير مسبوقة.
مع التحول الكبير نحو مراكز البيانات لتكون ركيزة أساسية للاقتصاد الرقمي، يبقى التحدي قائمًا ولا يمكن لقطاع التكنولوجيا مواءمة النمو السريع للذكاء الاصطناعي مع أهداف التخلي عن الطاقة التقليدية. ونتيجة لتلك العوامل، سيُمثل استهلاكها للطاقة قضية حاسمة في مكافحة تغير المناخ.
اليوم إبقاء محطات الوقود الأحفوري قيد التشغيل لتلبية الطلب المتزايد القادم من الثورة الصناعية الرابعة ليس خيارًا، بل ضرورة لا يمكن إنكارها. حتى وإن تعهدت شركات التكنولوجيا الكبرى بتشغيل مراكز البيانات بالطاقة المتجددة، فإن الواقع هو أن التوسع في الذكاء الصناعي وأدواته يفوق وتيرة التوسع في تبني مصادر الطاقة النظيفة. فالطاقة المتجددة ببساطة لا تتوسع بالسرعة الكافية لمواكبة نمو الذكاء الاصطناعي.
إقرأ أيضاً التعليقات جميع التعليقات المنشورة تعبر عن رأي كتّابها ولا تعبر بالضرورة عن رأي إيلاف أظهر التعليقات أضف تعليقك

author: Get News
title: Unveiling the Shadows of War: Emery Buxton’s Riveting World War I Saga | User | theeveningleader.com
text:
If you are a history enthusiast, then surely reading Emery Buxton's books will greatly help you comprehend various empires and World War I from a wider aspect. Also, through the pages of his books in various volumes, the author has invited readers on an extraordinary journey through the heart of World War I with his three-part historical novel series, reporting a War. Ideally, Volume I: The Changing Landscape offers a vivid portrayal of the Middle East, mainly before the period of the war, theater during the war, focusing on the fall of the Ottoman Empire and the rise of British colonialism. This series blends rich history with compelling human stories and war journalism.
A Deep Dive into Conflict and Transformation
Do not you think, at times it is essential for an individual to comprehend the root causes of conflicts? While reading the pages of this volume, " The Changing Landscape ," Buxton takes readers through the pivotal events and transformations in the Middle East during World War I. The novel highlights the interactions and conflicts between the Ottoman Empire and colonial powers, showcasing the complex geopolitical dynamics and the struggles of various ethnic and religious groups. Through the perspectives of war correspondents, readers gain a unique insight into the experiences of soldiers and civilians, as well as the dangers faced by those reporting from the front lines.
Major Themes of the Book
Historical Context: The author, with his extensive research, has majorly focused on the series that happened in history years ago that offers significant events and circumstances surrounding the Middle Eastern theater of World War I.
Ethical and Moral Reflection: Through the eyes of international correspondents, the series explores the ethical dilemmas and challenges faced by journalists during wartime.
Continuing the Journey: Volumes 2 and 3
Following The Changing Landscape, Volume 2: The Impact of War and Volume 3: The Path to Resolution delve deeper into the Ottoman Empire's role in World War I. These volumes explore strategic decisions, the eventual collapse of the empire, the emergence of new political alignments, and the rise of Arab nationalism.
For History Enthusiasts and Beyond
Reporting a War offers a captivating blend of historical fiction and war literature, making it a must-read for history enthusiasts, students, academics, and fans of war fiction.
About the Author
Emery Buxton, a specialist in international affairs, has served in the U.S. State Department and at major North American universities. He has dedicatedly researched and written on Islamic culture, both historically and in the modern era. Buxton's previous works include Sultans, Shamans, and Saints: Islam and Muslims in Southeast Asia and a series on the Korean War titled An Inconvenient War.

author: Michael Brauner
title: LOCKDOWN: Alabama players confirm increased security after Michigan sign-stealing scandal
text: While the Michigan Wolverines are undefeated, the Big 10 champions, and the No. 1 team in the country, Jim Harbaugh’s program has been in the headlines throughout the year for the all the wrong reasons as well. An alleged sign-stealing scandal that dominated the college football media sphere for months and led to Harbaugh being suspended the last three games of the regular season was enough for the Crimson Tide to change the way the players are watching film to prepare for the Rose Bowl. Players have not been allowed to watch film on their personal tablets individually, an unprecedented added layer of security, only watching film together as a team. Alabama wide receiver Isaiah Bond says the Crimson Tide can't watch film on their tablets because of the Michigan sign-stealing scandal. [pic.twitter.com/6lHwTbP62C] — Alabama Crimson Tide | AL.com (@aldotcomTide) [December 28, 2023] “We just didn’t want to take no chances,” star right tackle JC Latham said. “It’s a really big game. I think we have a really great film staff and guys who make sure our film is pretty secure but we’re just taking another precaution to make sure we’re all good.” Receiver Isaiah Bond said something similar, but that he was not extremely familiar with the situation and that no matter what, Michigan still has to play them. RELATED: [Why more pressure is on Michigan than Alabama](https://yellowhammernews.com/why-more-pressure-is-on-michigan-than-alabama/) “When we get on the field they’re gonna have to play us anyways, so all that sign-stealing isn’t gonna help them,” Bond stated. The investigation against Michigan is still ongoing and the extent to which wrongdoing was occurring is still unknown, but it seems like Nick Saban and company are taking no chances when it comes to preparing for the Wolverines.
